docs.text:
ev34j


A Java library for 
ev3dev
 devices.


Introduction


The 
Lego Mindstorms visual editor

is a great first programming environment. However, as things get more complex,
visual programming can get cumbersome and you want to  use code rather than blocks.
The 
ev34j-mindstorms library
 is meant to bridge the transition to code
by providing simple Java objects that map directly to the Mindstorms blocks in
the visual editor.


Example Code


import com.ev34j.mindstorms.motor.SteeringMotors;

public class SimpleSteeringMotors {

  public static void main(String[] args) {

    System.out.println(
Trying out SteeringMotors
);
    SteeringMotors motors = new SteeringMotors(
A
, 
B
);

    // Go forward 2 rotations at 25% power
    motors.onForRotations(0, 25, 2);
    motors.waitUntilStopped();

    // Go back 2 rotations at 25% power
    motors.onForRotations(0, -25, 2);
    motors.waitUntilStopped();
  }
}




Compatibility


The ev34j-mindstorms library works with these devices:




Lego Mindstorms - EV3


BrickPi


PiStorms




Usage


The 
ev34j-mindstorms-tutorial
 repo
describes how to setup your environment and execute ev34j-based programs.


Firebase Demo


The 
ev34j-mindstorms-firebase
 repo
demonstrates the use of 
Firebase
 with an ev34j robot.


ev34j-mindstorms Classes


The ev34j-mindstorms classes are outlined

here
.


Javadocs


The javadocs for ev34j-mindstorms are 
here
.


Acknowledgments


Sincere thanks to:






@dlech
 and 
@rhempel
 for their excellent 
ev3dev.org
 effort.






@jabrena
 for his work to provide a LeJOS-like Java API at 
ev3dev-lang-java
.
